title: The go-mode.el file on the web site is not an elisp file
body:
by **theaney**: 
I installed go from the PPA

    sudo apt-get install golang

so I didn't download the source code. I wanted the Emacs mode, so I did

    wget http://golang.org/misc/emacs/go-mode.el
    wget http://golang.org/misc/emacs/go-mode-load.el

The resulting go-mode-load.el file is an elisp file, but the go-mode.el file is an HTML
file.

Looking at it in a web browser, I see it's the code I want with some added
window-dressing. Shouldn't there be a plain text version? If not, why didn't
go-mode-load.el also get the fancy window-dressing?

Thanks!
